title: Ticket #6969: condor_prio should have a -constraint option
remarks:
2019-Mar-28 12:44:19 by johnkn:
TJ Knoeller [12:34 PM] A constraint arg for condor_prio would add a LOT of traffic to the schedd. The reason is that it doesn't set the prio, it adjusts it. So each job changed involves a GetAttribute call and a SetAttribute call, with a constraint, that's at least 2 round trips to the schedd for each job touched.

This how condor_prio works now when you specify a username. but I'm assuming that no-one ever does that because what would be the point?

So to actually do a constraint arg for condor_prio implies that we want to change the protocol, or have it modify the jobs using the same mechanism that Qedit uses.
